title: Rugby World Cup Pool A permutations: How Ireland, Scotland and Japan can still qualify for the quarter-finals
text:
Pool C, the supposed pool of death, has seen both England and France qualify for the quarter-finals with a game in hand. To the surprise of many, it is Pool A that has provided the photo finish.

Japan did the impossible, again, and toppled a tier-one nation while Ireland have looked sluggish after a stellar 2018 campaign.

Scotland fell disappointingly short against Ireland in their own opening fixture, but may yet go on to qualify should they convince against both Russia and Japan next week.

Here, Tom Cary runs the rule over these three Pool A contenders battling for the two top slots:
description: Pool C, the supposed pool of death, has seen both England and France qualify for the quarter-finals with a game in hand.
